job_description: Duration:4 months, with possibility of 8 months or 12 months extension. Preference will be given to students who are available for longer termsHours: 35/weekOffice Hour: 9 am – 5 pm (Mon – Fri)Salary Range: $15/hourStart date: May 1st, 2015 (or earlier)UBC Studios has an exciting opportunity for a student with interest and passion for media production. You will be able to hone your skills and develop new ones in filming, editing, camera and lighting. You will also have opportunities to use tools such as the Adobe Creative Suite.  This position provides experience in creating both educational media content and communications based content.Company Description:UBC Studios is an on-campus facility dedicated to creating engaging content for educational, research, communication and recruitment needs of faculties, administrative units and its partners.  UBC Studios is comprised of professional media producers, with experience in all areas of film production. Our new state-of-the-art-facility includes a full studio and in-house equipment. Job Summary:This position will involve assisting producers, editors and camera operators in video production and post-production.  You will have the opportunity to participate in all areas of video production from conceptualization to delivery. Production work involves both studio and on-location shoot assistance. You will learn to handle and operate professional camera equipment.You will also be responsible for administrative tasks.  Students are expected to be eager to learn new skills and open to participating in a variety of tasks.Primary Responsibilities• Ingest, transcode and organize media for editorial team• Set up and tear down equipment including lights, tripods, and back-drops during production, both in studio and on location, and participating in filming• Assist in post-production such as editing video and finding music• Document business workflow• Set up new office management software• Assist in day-to-day business operation to enhance workplace efficiency• Maintain accurate work records for data entry, invoicing and archiving• Organize work schedule to ensure deadlines are metResponsibilities could include:• Assist in preparing media workshops and presentations• Assist with script writing and creative briefs• Project and prospecting research• Perform other duties within scope of the positionQualification:This position is open to co-op students in any major.
job_requirements: Aptitude• Creative and self-motivated• Ability to multi-task and be flexible while working under tight deadlines• Ability to take direction as well as apply initiative• Enthusiasm to acquire new skills and earn new technologies• Excellent communication skills and ability to interact professionally with all levels of clients (staff, faculty, students and external)TechnicalKnowledge or willingness to learn:• Basic camera operating and audio recording skills• Creative software such as Final-Cut Pro X and the Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects, Premier ProStudent TestimonialCo-op student May 2014 – May 2015B.A. Anthropology“My terms with UBC Studios were an excellent opportunity to learn new skills about my field of interest after graduation. I enjoyed the team atmosphere and having the opportunity to learn about each stage of production and post-production while having the ability to ask questions.   It was great to be included in shoots as well as to see how budgets are built.  Students can expect to get hands-on experience with film and video experience and to learn software such as After Effects and Final Cut X.  Students have a lot of opportunity to tailor his or her work term to specific areas of interest.”Note: Please see related job posting, Media Production & Print Assistant [S15].If you are interested in both positions, please apply to one, and specify that you are open to being considered for both.Open To All Majors:No
